bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 8, 1921

div1.p: Rose writes that he will arrange for Noguchi's yellow fever vaccine and serum to be delivered to Chiclayo, Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 8, 1921
div1.opener:

THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISEN, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR

H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR

ERNST C. MEYER
DIRECTOR OF
SURVEYS AND EXHIBITS
MEMBERS
-----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN

WILLIAM H. WELCH

EDWIN N. EMBREE
SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
February 8, 1921.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
We have had a request today through the
Bank of the Americas for a supply of Doctor Noguchi's
yellow fever vaccine and serum to be shipped to Bonzi,
Banco Mercantil, Americano del Peru, Chiclayo. We
already had under way a shipment to Doctor Gil Cardenas
on the S/S “SANTA ELISA”, sailing February 9th. As this
boat does not stop at Eten, it was impossible to have
part of this shipment dropped at that port for Chiclayo.

2. A small supply of vaccine and serum was
sent some time ago to Doctor William C. Rucker, Chief
Quarantine Officer of the Canal Zone. We have today
cabled Doctor Rucker as follows:

SHIP EARLIEST OPPORTUNITY TO
DOCTOR HENRY CARTER CARE BONZI
BANCO MERCANTIL AMERICANO DEL PERU
CHICLAYO PERU ENTIRE SUPPLY NOGUCHI
VACCINE AND SERUM SHIPPING YOU FURTHER
SUPPLY THROUGH MEDICAL SUPPLY DEPOT.

3. Arrangements have been made, following
Doctor Rucker's instructions concerning shipment, to
send a larger supply to Panama through the Medical
Supply Depot, New York, on an Army transport sailing
Thursday, February 10th, from Hoboken. We are asking
Doctor Rucker to forward all or part of this shipment
to Chiclayo, according to later instructions from you.
I suggest that you keep Doctor Rucker informed of the
needs in Peru.

We shall be glad to have full information
about the situation in Chiclayo at your convenience.
We did hope before this to be able to greet you in
New York.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor Henry E. Carter
c/o American Consul
Lima, Peru
